isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - FRONT AXLE LOCKING HUBS - OPERATION - DISENGAGING THE LOCKING HUBS

svcproc.title: DISENGAGING THE LOCKING HUBS
svcproc.para: To disengage the locking hubs, turn both of the control dials counterclockwise to the "FREE" position. The arrow must point directly at the dot on the rim cap, otherwise the gears may rake against each other.

caution.para: Use fingers only to turn the control dials. If the dials do not move freely with your fingers, move the truck slightly forward or backward in two wheel drive standard gear range. If the hubs do not turn freely now, look for external damage or dirt around the control dials. Do not force the dials with tools.
Do not drive the truck unless the control dials are properly positioned and set identically.
To avoid excessive torque loads on the rear axle, do not drive the truck with the transfer case in low range and the hubs set in the "Free" position.
